Posted By: Aun (5/19/2010 3:42:38 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: The big drawback here is "if you have more cards in hand than each opponent". Any Modern deck that wants to play this will be running things like [Smallpox](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Smallpox), [Rotting Rats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rotting Rats), etc, meaning that you will rarely have more cards in hand. The whole point is to discard your own stuff also, and card for card that means you're down unless your opponent is playing aggro as well. The only exception would be something crazy like [Vexing Sphinx](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vexing Sphinx) or [Zur's Weirding](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zur's Weirding). Overall, you are better off running [Bloodghast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodghast) or [Nether Traitor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nether Traitor), usually.
posts.html:
The big drawback here is "if you have more cards in hand than each opponent". Any Modern deck that wants to play this will be running things like Smallpox, Rotting Rats, etc, meaning that you will rarely have more cards in hand. The whole point is to discard your own stuff also, and card for card that means you're down unless your opponent is playing aggro as well. The only exception would be something crazy like Vexing Sphinx or Zur's Weirding. Overall, you are better off running Bloodghast or Nether Traitor, usually.

Posted By: liir007 (8/21/2009 3:39:23 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Turn 1: Play [Swamp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swamp) ; cast [Cabal Therapy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cabal Therapy) (or any other "target player" {B} cost discard spell) and discard [Akuta, Born of Ash](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Akuta, Born of Ash).   
Turn 2: Sacrifice your Swamp to pull Akuta back to the battlefield.  
  
Sets you back a Swamp, but you now have a 3/2 black creature with Haste. Not an entirely bad deal, considering it cost {B}{B} to play out.
posts.html:

Turn 2: Sacrifice your Swamp to pull Akuta back to the battlefield.
